channel.title: New Guitar...?
channel.description: My birthday is coming up, and all I want is a newer guitar. The one I currently have is a Yamaha(don't get me started) EG303 with whammy (I've had it for years). Anyways, I'm looking for a good guitar that can is good for mostly rock / metal. I WAS thinking of a good old Warlock since they are cheap. Then again, I have seen the XPT700s and the DTT700 and they are sexy, but they look way too fucking expensive, so any suggestions?

@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“RXVL, post:25, topic:277448”]http://www.rondomusic.com Their Les Paul copies are equal if not better than Gibson, for an extreme fraction of the price. I have an AL3000, it’s amazing. And if you don’t believe me, the people over at http://www.agileguitarforum.com would be glad to change your opinion.

^^ My AL before modifications.[/quote]Nothing is better than gibson.

item.title: New Guitar...?
item.dc:creator: @jensie jensie
item.description:
@jensie wrote:

Mopman:

So why are you against SquiER (plz people, plz) but not Epiphone?

Well I’m not against any of them. I just think both Squier and Epiphone are rather risky to buy (because they are daughter-brands). While Ibanez and Jackson (Ltd is a part of ESP but I never played one…) are original brands.

I just said I was lucky with receiving mine in a perfect condition. (I played it in the store and took that exact guitar)

Read full topic

item.description:

So why are you against SquiER (plz people, plz) but not Epiphone?

Read full topic

item.title: New Guitar...?
item.dc:creator: @jensie jensie
item.description:
@jensie wrote:

Squire just can’t compete to brands like Ibanez, Jackson, ESP (LTD), …
I bought myslef an Epiphone Les Paul which is actually a great guitar. Playing metal, blues, rock, anything basicly. But you really need to be lucky (same goes out to Squire). Those brands are made in China and Japan, mostly hand-made.
The biggest difference between an Epi and a real Gibson is the kind of wood that the body is made of. And they don’t spend alot of attention to make sure the Epiphone guitars are OK. While Gibson guitars need to have a special booklet that comes with them, signed by the guy who made sure the guitar is in a perfect condition.

For more information check :
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3vARFwbhLOM

Read full topic

item.title: New Guitar...?
item.dc:creator: @XharveyX XharveyX
item.description:
@XharveyX wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:11, topic:277448”]contrary to what everyoen else has said, i wouldnt recommend pimping out a squier, theres more to them than just shoddy pickups*

*owns a squier and likes it for what it is. didnt buy it to be an epic tricked out guitar.[/quote]

Fair enough but i mean, they’re quite cheap and well i know this is me but i find them awesome to strip down and modify it. Im doing it to my Alba Telecaster. Will have completely new paint job, pickups, strings etc.

Read full topic

item.title: New Guitar...?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

there really are some good squiers about, and everyone thinks they have a great one (including me tbh)

there are also some terribad lemons around with crap bodies and shit

if you must buy one with the intention of putting decent pups and stuff in it, make sure you take someone who is knowledgable about guitars with you when you buy it or youre basically gambling imo

but nah not denying that they can be nice little guitars

Read full topic

item.title: New Guitar...?
item.dc:creator: @archerer98 Archer
item.description:
@archerer98 wrote:

Can’t go wrong with a Black Beauty Unhandled. But I love using my Ibanez Iceman for metal songs and with my Seymour pups the tone is great, but for anything else I use my Gibson Les Paul. My dad modified his squire like hell, new pups…re did the finish on the neck, set it up, fret work, and more, and sounds great now.

Read full topic

item.title: New Guitar...?
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

contrary to what everyoen else has said, i wouldnt recommend pimping out a squier, theres more to them than just shoddy pickups*

*owns a squier and likes it for what it is. didnt buy it to be an epic tricked out guitar.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

Epiphones are great, and have the same Gibson style for a lot cheaper.

I’m planning on picking up one of these some time, around $900:

Read full topic

item.title: New Guitar...?
item.dc:creator: @Waffendennis Waffendennis
item.description:
@Waffendennis wrote:

Not to mention, what kind of style do you want to play?

A Ibanez RG series is an excellent choise, with the H-S-H configuration.
You could always upgrade the pups later with some active ones like what I perfer!

A EMG 81-60 configuration. Plus active pups will turn a cheap guitar into a ‘pro’ sounding guitar ;)! Stay in mind that ‘clean’ sounds will always have a ‘bite’ to it!

Read full topic
